title: Canonical Coherence and Systematic Reading
objective: Check theological claims against the broader canon for coherence

segments.audio_script: This is lesson fifteen. We evaluate claims for coherence with the whole canon.
No passage required. Consider relevant cross-references and major doctrinal loci.
Canonical coherence means new claims should not contradict central teachings. The canon provides checks and balances for interpretation.
Compare your claim with parallel texts and key doctrinal passages. If tensions exist, revisit your exegesis and qualifications.
Key skill: theological humilityâ€”seek coherence and revise when necessary.
What should you do if a claim seems to contradict canonical teaching?
This completes lesson fifteen. Next lesson practices whole-text synthesis on a short passage.

vocabulary.definition: Agreement of an interpretation with the broader witness and teaching of Scripture

study_notes: Use major theological themes as orienting horizons but let primary texts constrain conclusions.
